perturbation.original_text: Heritage and Jasper will comply with all laws and regulations applicable to production of the Products, including without limitation, the laws and regulations of the United States Food and Drug Administration ("FDA"), United States Public Health Service ("PHS"), and any and all other applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations. Heritage warrants that the Products shall be released free from defects in workmanship and shall be manufactured in accordance with this Agreement and 21 C.F.R. Part 110 which is entitled "Current Good Manufacturing Practice in Manufacturing, Packing or Holding Human Food" and as it may be amended from time-to-time.
perturbation.changed_text: Heritage and Jasper will comply with most laws and regulations applicable to production of the Products, including the regulations of the United States Public Health Service ("PHS"). Heritage warrants that the Products shall be released free from major defects in workmanship and shall be manufactured in accordance with this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The omission of 'all' from laws and regulations, plus the selective removal of FDA compliance and the specific GMP standards (21 C.F.R. Part 110), weakens the commitment to quality and safety. By changing 'all defects' to 'major defects', this reduces consumer protection. California law, where Heritage is based, has stringent food safety regulations which might be undermined.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 21 C.F.R. Part 110 - Current Good Manufacturing Practice in Manufacturing, Packing or Holding Human Food; California Health and Safety Code related to food safety.

perturbation.original_text: The Products, when delivered to Premier in accordance with this Agreement, shall be free of contaminants, merchantable, fit for intended use and shall not be adulterated within the meaning of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.
perturbation.changed_text: The Products, when delivered to Premier in accordance with this Agreement, shall be generally free of significant contaminants and fit for general use.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the guarantee of 'merchantable' and the specific reference to the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, along with changing 'free of contaminants' to 'generally free of significant contaminants,' weakens consumer protection against adulterated or unsafe products. This could be a violation of consumer protection laws that ensure products meet certain quality standards and are safe for consumption or use.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act; California consumer protection laws.

perturbation.original_text: Heritage and Jasper hold all permits and licenses required for Heritage and/or Jasper to manufacture the Products under the Agreement. Heritage will obtain, and shall ensure that Jasper obtains, all ingredients and packaging materials from suppliers that are approved by Premier in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: Heritage and Jasper intend to maintain permits and licenses required to manufacture the Products. Heritage will attempt to obtain ingredients and packaging materials from suppliers.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'hold all' to 'intend to maintain' introduces uncertainty regarding compliance with licensing requirements. Also, 'will obtain' to 'will attempt to obtain' weakens the obligation to use approved suppliers. This introduces a **legal risk**, potentially violating laws that mandate specific permits and approved supply chains for food manufacturing facilities. By using terms like 'intend to' and 'attempt to,' the manufacturer is not fully committing to these consumer rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Health and Safety Code related to food manufacturing licenses and permits; Federal regulations regarding approved suppliers.
